page.title: 20TRANSPORT:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: 94% Bedingham & 77% Hedenham families run at least 1 car,but some pensioners & some women & children may be without transport during the day,but for bi- cycles.Public transport includes a bus service between Bungay & Norwich along the main road,diverting thro' Woodton St. Hedenham & Bedingham lie off this main road & most of their people have at least a 1/2 mile walk to the bus. Neighbours Alburgh,Denton & Bedingham run a{Community Minibus}manned by vol- unteers.Bi-weekly this plies between Bedingham,Denton & Bungay.It is part- funded by Norfolk CC.These services allow folk to visit nearby Bungay for shopping or GPs,to catch buses to Harleston or Lowestoft & in Norwich to connect with trains.Evening buses though are infrequent. (Researched & written by Hedenham, Woodton & District WIs,families & friends)
